metadata.title: NIW Qualification Assessment & Service Selection
metadata.description: Essential qualification assessment and service selection for EB2-NIW applications
metadata.target_audience: STEM PhD holders seeking NIW qualification

qualification_assessment.title: NIW Qualification Assessment
qualification_assessment.description: Let's first assess your basic qualifications for NIW eligibility. This helps us determine if you're a good candidate and identify areas for improvement.

EDUCATION_LEVEL.question: What is your highest degree COMPLETED/OBTAINED? (Do not select degrees currently in progress)
EDUCATION_LEVEL.explanation: NIW requires at least a Master's degree, but PhD holders have significantly stronger cases. Your education level directly impacts your eligibility strength.
EDUCATION_LEVEL.legal_importance: Critical - Minimum requirement for NIW eligibility

PUBLICATION_COUNT.question: How many peer-reviewed publications do you have?
PUBLICATION_COUNT.explanation: Publications demonstrate your research contributions. A minimum of 3 peer-reviewed publications is required for NIW eligibility. Include only peer-reviewed journal articles and conference papers.
writing_tips: Include both journal articles and conference papers
Don't include preprints or working papers

CITATION_COUNT.question: What is your total citation count across all publications?
CITATION_COUNT.explanation: Citations show the impact and recognition of your work. A minimum of 15 citations is required for NIW eligibility. Higher citations strengthen your case. You can find this on Google Scholar.

RESEARCH_FIELD.question: Is your primary research field in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics)?
RESEARCH_FIELD.explanation: STEM fields are highly valued for national interest. Being in a STEM field strengthens your NIW petition.

WORK_EXPERIENCE.question: How many years of relevant work experience do you have? (Enter 0 if you are a student)
WORK_EXPERIENCE.explanation: Work experience can demonstrate practical application of your research, but is not required. Many students and recent graduates have successfully obtained NIW approval based on their research contributions alone.

CURRENT_POSITION.question: What is your current professional position?
CURRENT_POSITION.explanation: Your current role helps us understand how you're applying your expertise and will be used to customize your petition materials.

optional_enhancements.title: Optional Supporting Materials & Processing Options
optional_enhancements.description: These optional elements can enhance your NIW case but are not required to proceed. You can always add them later using our editable Overleaf output.

RECOMMENDATION_LETTERS.question: Would you like to include recommendation letters in your initial application?
options: Yes, I want to include recommendation letters
No, I'll add them later if needed
RECOMMENDATION_LETTERS.explanation: Recommendation letters improve approval chances by showcasing external validation from experts in your field. They're not required immediately and can be added later if USCIS issues an RFE.
RECOMMENDATION_LETTERS.system_behavior: Not required for initial draft generation. Can be added later if USCIS issues an RFE or manually added into the Overleaf output.

PREMIUM_PROCESSING.question: Would you like to apply with Premium Processing (PP)?
PREMIUM_PROCESSING.explanation: Premium Processing provides faster USCIS decisions but may increase the chance of receiving an RFE due to faster deadlines and potentially more scrutiny.
facts: USCIS may issue more RFEs for PP cases due to faster deadlines
Quicker decision but possibly more scrutiny
Standard processing is safer for approval if time allows
PREMIUM_PROCESSING.system_advice: Not essential unless under a time crunch. Standard processing is safer for approval if time allows.

AWARDS_MEDIA_GRANTS.question: Would you like to include awards, media coverage, or research grants in your case?
options: Yes, I want to include these enhancements
No, I'll stick with basic case
AWARDS_MEDIA_GRANTS.explanation: Awards, media mentions, and grants showcase national interest, public recognition, and funding competitiveness. These can be added manually to the Overleaf output.
limitations: Can be added manually to Overleaf output
System may expand to support these features based on user demand

basic_information.title: Basic Personal Information
basic_information.description: Essential personal and contact information for your NIW application.

PERSONAL_LAST_NAME.question: What is your last name (family name) as it appears on your passport?
PERSONAL_LAST_NAME.explanation: Your legal name as it appears on official documents. This must match your passport and other legal documents exactly.
PERSONAL_LAST_NAME.legal_importance: Critical - Name consistency is required for all immigration documents

PERSONAL_FIRST_NAME.question: What is your first name (given name) as it appears on your passport?
PERSONAL_FIRST_NAME.explanation: Your legal first name as it appears on official documents. Include middle names if they appear on your passport.
PERSONAL_FIRST_NAME.legal_importance: Critical - Name consistency is required for all immigration documents

CURRENT_EMAIL.question: What is your current Google email address?
CURRENT_EMAIL.explanation: We'll use this email to send you updates about your case, request additional information, and provide important notifications.
CURRENT_EMAIL.validation: Must be a valid Google email format

CURRENT_PHONE.question: What is your current phone number?
CURRENT_PHONE.explanation: Phone number for urgent communications and verification purposes. Include country code if outside the US.

CURRENT_ADDRESS.question: What is your current country of residence?
CURRENT_ADDRESS.placeholder: Select your current country of residence
CURRENT_ADDRESS.explanation: Your current country of residence is required for immigration processing.

COUNTRY_OF_BIRTH.question: What is your country of birth?
COUNTRY_OF_BIRTH.explanation: Your country of birth is required for immigration processing and verification purposes.

GRADUATION_DATE.question: What is your estimated graduation date? (If currently enrolled)
GRADUATION_DATE.explanation: This helps us understand your timeline and plan follow-up for when you become eligible.
GRADUATION_DATE.legal_importance: Used for lead qualification and follow-up planning
